com.snakk.advertising
Interface SnakkVideoInterstitialAd

public interface SnakkVideoInterstitialAd

Video interstitials are full screen ads that display a video ad in their own Activity. Video interstitials are best used at discrete stopping points in your app's flow, such as at the end of a game level, or when the player dies.

Simple example:

 VideoInterstitialAd videoInterstitialAd = SnakkAdvertising.getVideoInterstitialAdForZone(context, "YOUR_ZONE_ID");
 videoInterstitialAd.show(); // video interstitial is loaded and shown asynchronously
Instances of VideoInterstitialAdImpl are not safe for use by multiple threads.

Nested Class Summary
static interface SnakkVideoInterstitialAd.SnakkVideoInterstitialAdListener
          Implement this interface to be notified of video interstitial ad lifecycle changes.
 
Method Summary
 SnakkVideoInterstitialAd.SnakkVideoInterstitialAdListener getListener()

Method Detail

isLoaded

boolean isLoaded()
Used to determine if video interstitial is ready to be shown.

Returns:
true if ready for display, false otherwise

load

void load()
Fire off an asynchronous request to server for a video interstitial ad. Use isLoaded() or SnakkVideoInterstitialAd.SnakkVideoInterstitialAdListener to determine when video interstitial is loaded.

show

void show()
Display video interstitial to user. If video interstitial is not loaded, load() will be called and the video interstitial will be loaded and shown asynchronously. Use isLoaded() or SnakkVideoInterstitialAd.SnakkVideoInterstitialAdListener to determine when video interstitial is loaded.

setListener

void setListener(SnakkVideoInterstitialAd.SnakkVideoInterstitialAdListener videoInterstitialListener)
Parameters:
videoInterstitialListener - the listener instance that will be notified of ad lifecycle events

getListener

SnakkVideoInterstitialAd.SnakkVideoInterstitialAdListener getListener()
